results.title: Plasmo
results.creator_credit: Anthony Lawrence, Tony Wright, Beyond International, Film Victoria and Plasmo Mega Studios
results.brief_description: Plasmo, Parsty and Nik Nik are stuck on the planet Pynco, desperate to return home, when they come across two explorers, Brucho and Coredor. This tape includes seven adventures previously screened on ABC television. Episodes include: PLASMO AND THE MOONTOWER, PLASMO BLASTS OFF, PLASMO IN DEEP SPACE, PLASMO ARRIVES, TOUR OF MONJOTROLDECLIPDOC, PLASMO AND THE SPACE GHOSTS, PLASMO AND THE BOOKWORM. The magic of puppetry and animation used to create Plasmo’s world will delight children everywhere. Voices provided by Abbe Holmes, Pia Morley and Phil Houghton.

results.title: Plas Newydd, Angelsey, Wales
results.brief_description: Plas Newydd, which means “new house”, is the country home of the Marquis of Angelsey, Wales. The film examines this stately home and the present Marquis of Angelsey discusses its history. Part of the series “A Place in Europe”.

results.title: Planning a city
results.brief_description: Sydney, the second greatest white city in the British Empire. A critical analysis of Sydney and the initial lack of city planning. Despite the surrounding beauty and the opportunity for wise planning, Sydney became a crowded and poorly serviced city. Many houses were built on narrow, cramped and dimly lit streets which contributed to the escalation of crime and disease. Those responsible for constructing roadways rarely considered the impact on residents. Many schools and shopping centres were built on major thoroughfares resulting in a high rate of school children and housewives being killed by cars. Considering the harbourside location, many of the views became obstructed by buildings housing the privileged. The ‘Town and Country Planning Act of 1945’ was introduced to provide an opportunity to remedy the mistakes of the past by planning for future improvements. This film includes scenes of Sydney as it was in the middle of this century and what is now historical footage of cars, buses, trams, trains, ferries and horse and carts.

results.title: Planes, trains and automobiles
results.brief_description: It’s Thanksgiving and Neal Page (Steve Martin) is looking forward to spending some quality time with the family. While on the flight home, Neal is seated next to obnoxious shower curtain ring salesman Del Griffith (John Candy). When a snow storm causes their plane to be rerouted, the two are reluctantly united by their misfortune. Thus begins a disastrous chain of events that transcends all forms of public transport and threatens to make Neal miss Thanksgiving all together.

results.title: Plagued. Episodes 3 & 4
results.creator_credit: Aviva Ziegler, Edward Goldwyn, Janet Bell, Deanne Edwards, Channel Four, Goldwyn Associates and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Invisible armies examines infectious diseases and how they have been carried around the world as cultures come into contact with each other, and also how some previously eliminated diseases, such as measles and TB, are making a comeback in the western world because of carelessness about immunisation programs. Diseases discussed include syphilis, malaria and smallpox. “Will we ever learn?” Never before have we had such powerful weapons against disease but the tendency to depend on them too much has led to a philosophy of cure rather than prevention. The program looks at AIDS, syphilis and diseases associated with tobacco use and salt. Norman Swan wrote and narrates this thought provoking series, which contends that the real causes of epidemics are social forces.

results.title: Plan 9 from outer space = Grave robbers from outer space
results.creator_credit: Edward Wood Jr and Reynolds Pictures
results.brief_description: The local authorities join forces with the military to ward off an invasion of flying saucers. Undeterred, the aliens continue their attempt to conquer Earth by resurrecting corpses from a San Fernando cemetery. “Plan 9 from outer space” has been described as the worst film ever made. This dubious honour has led to the cult status and notoriety the film enjoys to this day, proving that any publicity is good publicity. Those who have seen Tim Burton’s homage, “Ed Wood”, will enjoy seeing this original masterpiece. Bela Lugosi played the definitive vampire as Count Dracula in Tod Browning’s 1931 classic horror. In “Plan 9”, he revives his ghoulish persona in this, his final screen role.

results.title: Plagued. Episodes 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Edward Goldwyn, Aviva Ziegler, Deanne Edwards, Janet Bell, Channel Four, Film Australia and Goldwyn Associates
results.brief_description: Conceived, written and narrated by award winning medical broadcaster, Dr. Norman Swan, this four part series investigates the relationship between history, destiny and disease. “The Origins of disease” investigates, through various case studies, including Korean haemorrhagic fever, shell shock, RSI and heart disease, how new diseases arise. We also discover that some are not diseases at all, but suffering made worse by factors as diverse as medical jargon and management style. “Epidemics: products of progress” takes up the theme that, ironically, throughout history, epidemics have been the results of so-called progress, and that despite medical technology, we are still vulnerable to old and new diseases, such as plague, cholera and AIDS which have the power to change the course of history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Goldwyn, Aviva Ziegler, Deanne Edwards, Janet Bell, Channel Four, Film Australia and Goldwyn Associates

results.title: Placido: a year in the life of Placido Domingo
results.creator_credit: Revel Guest, Group W, Channel 4 and Transatlantic Films
results.brief_description: Documentary made for television portraying a year in the life of one of the greatest opera singers of our time, Placido Domingo. This charming and charismatic performer takes us on a journey around the world from the major opera houses such as the Royal Opera House Covent Garden and La Scala Milan, to the Metropolitan Opera House in New York. He also manages to include appearances on television shows with Carol Burnett in Los Angeles and Charles Aznavour in Paris. The film includes excerpts from his performances in Tosca, The Tales of Hoffmann, Ernani, Otello, La fanciulla del West, Manon Lescaut and the Zeffirelli film of La Traviata. Also features Dame Kiri te Kanawa in Die Fledermaus.

results.title: Pixote
results.creator_credit: Hector Babenco, Jose Pinto, Paulo Francini, Embrafilme, Paulo Francini Productions and Jose Pinto Productions
results.brief_description:
“During a routine police sweep of the squalid streets of Sao Paulo, Pixote, an abandoned 10-year-old boy, the effeminate Lilica and another youth are taken to a detention centre. The three boys escape, aided by Lilica’s lover, and get involved with a homosexual drug dealer and an aging alcoholic prostitute. The performances by actual street kids are horrifyingly natural.” Babenco’s film was one of the first to address the problem of Rio de Janeiro’s street kids, and with the combination of stark street images and symbolic imagery, the film plays out as a hallucinatory nightmare. A startling critique of third world conditions and societal indifference to the plight of individuals, in particular children, forced to live in appalling conditions. A child’s life crushed by economic depression, and an astounding performance from Fernando Ramos da Silva, make ‘Pixote’ an emotionally gut-wrenching film. Reference: Holt Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Paulo Francini, Jose Pinto ; director, Hector Babenco ; writer, Hector Babenco, Jorge Duran ; photography, Rodolfo Sanches ; music, John Neschling ; editing, Luiz Elias.
Cast: Fernando Ramos da Silva, Jorge Juliao, Gilberto Moura, Marilia Pera, Jose Nilson dos Santos, Elke Maravilha, Jardel Filho.

results.title: Pixillation
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Knowlton, Lillian Schwartz and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: An experiment in film art using computer graphics and music by the Moog synthesiser. Inventive combinations of colour, form and motion have been produced. Music by Gershon Kingsley; crystal growth and computer graphics by Bell Labs.
